page.title: 18Religion in St. Agnes
page.content: Prominent in the area are three churches - the Roman Catholic "Our Lady of the Sea" in Trevaunance Road, the Anglican Parish Church in Church- town, and the Methodist Church in British Road. The oldest one is the Parish Church, built some time before 1331 - the exact date is not known. The font is very old and carved from Catacluse stone. The carved painted figure that holds the alms box is another ancient survivor, probably dating from Queen Elizabeth I. Services in the Parish Church are held four times on Sundays, and are reasonably well attended. The Methodist Church has undergone a sweeping change recently, being made into a single-storey church on the first floor and a large hall on the ground floor. The church and the Sunday School are both very active.
